articles.author: Matthew Loh
articles.title: Taiwan 7-Eleven stores say TVs hacked to show anti-Pelosi messages
articles.description: Meanwhile, Taiwan's Presidential Palace said cyberattack traffic on its website spiked by 200 times hours before Nancy Pelosi's arrival in Taipei.
articles.content: Some 7-Eleven stores in Taiwan reported on Wednesday that their store TVs had been hacked by an "unknown source" to display messages telling House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to leave the island, per local … [+2019 chars]

articles.title: China has warned airlines to avoid the airspace near Taiwan
articles.description: After Pelosi landed, China announced it will hold military exercises — including live drills — around Taiwan from Thursday to Sunday,

articles.author: Matthew Loh
articles.title: Asia's 2 richest men: Ambani vs Adani wealth, business empire, and more
articles.description: Signs are emerging that Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani may soon clash for the same business territory, Bloomberg reported.

articles.author: Charles R. Davis
articles.title: The 11 Republicans voted against the PACT Act providing aid for veterans
articles.description: The 11 Republicans voted against the bill a week after 30 of their GOP colleagues had joined them in stalling final passage of the measure.
articles.content:
Eleven Republican senators voted Tuesday against a bipartisan measure, the PACT Act, that is designed to help veterans who were exposed to toxic chemicals while deployed abroad.

articles.author: Charles R. Davis
articles.title: Senate passes PACT Act, providing aid to veterans exposed to burn pits
articles.description: The bill heads to President Joe Biden's desk after Republicans previously blocked the legislation, causing an uproar among veterans groups.
articles.content: The US Senate voted 86-11 on Tuesday to provide billions of dollars in new aid to military veterans who were exposed to burn pits and other sources of potentially lethal toxins while deployed abroad.… [+2263 chars]

articles.author: Rebecca Cohen
articles.title: Georgia allows claiming 'unborn children' as dependents on tax returns
articles.description: Any Georgia taxpayer who had a fetus with a heartbeat between July 20 and December 31 can claim it as a dependent on their taxes this year.
articles.content:
Georgia will now allow people to claim their unborn fetuses as dependent on their tax returns in light of the Supreme Court overturning abortion rights in June.
